content:
A musical marathon sounds like a wonderful idea!

Les Misérables is a timeless classic, and there are a few ways to re-watch it, depending on your preferences and setup. Here are some options:

**Streaming:**

* Amazon Prime Video: You can stream the 2012 movie adaptation starring Hugh Jackman, Anne Hathaway, and Eddie Redmayne with an Amazon Prime subscription.
* HBO Max: If you have a subscription to HBO Max, you can also stream the 2012 movie adaptation.
* YouTube: You can purchase or rent the movie on YouTube Movies.

**Digital Purchase or Rent:**

* iTunes: You can buy or rent the 2012 movie adaptation on iTunes.
* Google Play Movies & TV: You can buy or rent the movie on Google Play.
* Vudu: You can buy or rent the movie on Vudu.
* Microsoft Store: You can buy or rent the movie on Microsoft Store.

**DVD/Blu-ray:**

* If you prefer to own a physical copy, you can purchase the DVD or Blu-ray disc from online retailers like Amazon or in-store at a local video rental shop.

Consider the following factors to decide which option is best for you:

* **Availability:** Check if the movie is available on your preferred streaming platform or if you need to rent or buy it.
* **Quality:** If you have a 4K TV or a high-quality sound system, you might want to opt for a digital purchase or rent in 4K or HD. DVDs and Blu-rays can also offer high-quality video and audio.
* **Cost:** Streaming services might be the most cost-effective option if you already have a subscription. Renting or buying a digital copy can be a one-time cost. Purchasing a physical copy can be a more significant upfront investment.
* **Special Features:** If you're interested in behind-the-scenes content, cast interviews, or other special features, a DVD or Blu-ray might be the way to go.

Whichever option you choose, I hope you have a fantastic time re-watching Les Misérables!
